I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone. This is a prophecy of Jesus Christ, in which he is called a stone, a tried stone (or a stone tested for strength), and a precious corner stone. A cornerstone adds permanence and strength to the foundation of a building. Here the building is the latter-day Zion, and "he that believeth" may have a "sure foundation" on which to build (1 Pet. 2:6-8).

he that believeth shall not make haste. Peter's quotation of Isaiah here reads, "He that believeth on him shall not be confounded" (1 Pet. 2:6), and Paul's quotation reads, "shall not be ashamed" (Rom. 9:33; 10:11). The meaning of this phrase, then, is: "Whosoever believes on him [Christ, the stone] shall not be [confounded or] ashamed."
